name: Poka Labs
headline: The modern operating system for chemical manufacturing.
description:
Poka Labs is developing an AI platform to automate operations tasks in chemical manufacturing, beginning with production scheduling. Traditionally, these tasks are performed manually using spreadsheets. Our software seamlessly integrates with existing data sources such as data historians, emails, and PDFs to automate analytics, scheduling, changes, and communication within a single platform.

Malay and Andrew met while pursuing their MBAs at Harvard Business School. Malay previously worked as an engineer in the specialty chemical industry, saving his employers over $100 million across US, China, and German plants. Andrew worked as a software engineer on data infrastructure at Meta and optimization problems at a seed-stage startup. He also completed a Masters degree at Harvard specializing in Machine Learning.

founders.name: Andrew Bass, Founder
founders.description:
Andrew is the Co-Founder and CTO of Poka Labs. 

Before Poka, he worked on critical data infrastructure systems at Meta, as well as optimization software at a Series A startup (acquired) that helped mobility companies boost their revenue 40%.

He has both an MBA and MS degree at Harvard where he focused on ML systems.

founders.name: Malay Shah, Founder
founders.description:
Malay is the Co-Founder and CEO of Poka Labs.

He earned degrees in Chemical Engineering and Economics from NC State and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

With a background in the specialty chemicals industry, Malay has held various positions in operations and engineering working across plants in US, Germany, and China. His work in deploying chemical expertise with advanced analytics has saved his previous employers tens of millions of dollars.

generated_description:
**Poka Labs: Revolutionizing Chemical Manufacturing with AI**

Poka Labs is not just another startup; it's the pioneer of an AI-powered operating system specifically designed for chemical manufacturing. Founded in 2023 and currently participating in Y Combinator's Batch S24, the San Francisco-based company is on a mission to automate operational tasks in the industry, starting with production scheduling. Yes, that’s right—no more laborious manual work with spreadsheets.

### The Founders

The brains behind Poka Labs, Malay and Andrew, met during their MBAs at Harvard Business School. Malay brings a wealth of experience from his engineering role in the specialty chemical industry, where he saved employers over $100 million across multiple countries. Andrew, on the other hand, honed his software engineering skills at Meta and a seed-stage startup, specializing in data infrastructure and machine learning—so you know he’s not just throwing buzzwords around.

### What They Do

Poka Labs has developed a seamless platform that integrates existing data sources—think data historians, emails, and PDFs—to automate analytics, scheduling, and communication all in one spot. This means that teams can react to unexpected changes and last-minute orders in seconds, a critical advantage in a field where every minute counts.

Current features of their platform include:
- **Automated Production Scheduling:** Keep tabs on your plant’s progress and adapt quickly to changes.
- **Workflow Automation:** Eliminate tedious data entry from your email.
- **Manufacturing Batch Record Verification:** Deploy customized AI agents to verify common issues.

### The Team

Though small, the Poka Labs team of three packs a punch with world-class expertise in software, chemicals, and business. With their backgrounds, they’re incredibly well-positioned to understand and meet the unique challenges in the chemical manufacturing sector.

### Upcoming Events

If you're curious and want to see their solutions in action, Poka Labs will be at the SOCMA Show in Nashville from February 19 to 21. It’s a great opportunity to grasp what this innovative platform has to offer firsthand.

In a nutshell, Poka Labs is on a trajectory to put the chemical manufacturing industry on autopilot, utilizing the advancements of AI and automation. They are shaping the future of how chemical operations function, and if you're in that industry, it’s a journey worth watching. Check them out at [Poka Labs](https://www.pokalabs.com) or catch them live at their upcoming events!
